Common Stock - Technology Sector Blue Chip Equity|348=5|349=A|349=B|349=C|349=D|349=E|107=Apple Inc.|15=USD|336=REGULAR|625=1|58=This is a comprehensive security definition for Apple Inc. common stock traded on NASDAQ. The security is a blue-chip equity in the technology sector with high liquidity and daily trading volume exceeding 50 million shares. Market makers provide continuous two-sided quotes during regular trading hours from 09:30 to 16:00 EST. The security is eligible for margin trading with standard requirements and supports various order types including market, limit, stop, and algorithmic orders. Settlement occurs on T+2 basis. The security is a component of major indices including S&P 500, NASDAQ-100, and Dow Jones Industrial Average. Corporate actions including dividends and stock splits are processed according to standard market conventions. Real-time market data is available through multiple data feeds with Level 1 and Level 2 quotes. The security supports pre-market trading from 04:00 to 09:30 and after-hours trading from 16:00 to 20:00 EST with potentially wider spreads. Options on this underlying are available with multiple expiration cycles and strike prices. The security has strong institutional ownership and is widely held in mutual funds and ETFs. Regulatory oversight is provided by SEC and FINRA. The company reports quarterly earnings and maintains an active investor relations program. Historical volatility metrics and beta calculations are available for risk management purposes.|354=850||827=1|561=100|562=1|10=123|
